page.title: 10St Mary's Hospital
page.content: The west wing was built in 1845 and the east wing added in 1876, to cope with the growing number of infectious diseases, including scarlet fever from which 483 died. A total of{2,450 staff,}of which 1,029 are nurses, look after{25,000} 'in' patients and{120,000}'out' patients a year. For these they have {799 beds.}The hospital has to pay{Â£20} {million}a year, 75% of which is for salaries; the rest goes towards cleaning materials, telephones, drugs, medical and surgical equipment. The smaller east wing has Renal, Isolation, Geriatric and Children's Wards; the west wing has a specialist Cardiac and Chest Unit, Radio Therapy, Cancer Research, General Surgery, Gynaecology and a modern Maternity Wing. -Peter Buckett:Penhale Middle School
